name: Haimu Heartbeat/Whisper
description: Silent switches with plastic springs on the stem.

name: LCET Dreamsea
description: Silent switches similar to Haimu design.

name: Emotoys Little Daisy Switch Linear
description: Linear switches similar to Haimu design.

name: LICHICX Lucy/jingWan/RED/Old DG
description: Silent switches featuring a three-component stem.

name: GATERON 0Â° Silent Switch
description: Features an unusual dampener system.

name: Gateron Cap
description: Redesigned stem for stability; the central bottom pin is not used and can be shortened to reduce keyboard height.

name: ProWorld MX clone
description: First MX switches to use a leaf spring clicking mechanism (found in vintage Alps/SMK/Omron).

name: Clickez
description: Modern ProWorld equivalent based on Cap stems.

name: Gateron Melodic
description: Similar to Clickez but with a leaf spring at a nearly 90-degree angle; similar to KS-33.

name: Aristotle MX clone
description: Clicky switches with "fangs"; recently recreated in Outemu Phoenix and TKC Blackberry. Only MX switches with >4mm travel.

name: Cherry MX Yellow
description: Linear switches where Aristotle stems were used in Cherry housings (often found in Chicony keyboards).

name: Hirose Cherry MX Pale Yellow
description: Yellow Cherry switches manufactured by a Japanese contractor.

name: Cherry MX Alps Clear
description: MX Clear switches with an Alps Mount (likely not produced by Cherry).

name: Cherry MX Alps Click
description: MX Blue switches with an Alps Mount (likely not produced by Cherry).

name: Outemu Blue Switch (ALPs Mount)
description: Similar to the MX Alps Click but produced by Outemu.

name: Cherry MX White / Click Grey
description: Clicky switches that were allegedly lubed to act as tactile switches.

name: Cherry MX Olympia Linear Clear
description: Modified housing shape causing the plate to mount higher.

name: Cherry MX Lock
description: Features a "lock-in" / toggle mechanism.

name: Kailh BOX
description: First MX switches with a shroud around the stem for dust protection (similar to Futaba MA/SMK).

name: Kailh Box Hush
description: Unique silent system with multiple dampeners; one completely covers the bottom.

name: Box Mute Jade
description: Silent clickbar switch design.

name: Kailh MIX-7
description: Switchable modes between clicky and linear.

name: Diamond Avalon
description: Significantly modified stem and housing shapes.

name: Taiwan Jet Axis/Pro World
description: Unique design featuring dual stem guides.

name: Tecsee Honey Peach
description: Features a steel stem.

name: Novelkeys Cream/Cream+
description: Modular stem design allowing for interchangeable tips.

name: Novelkeys Cream Arc
description: Features conical springs.

name: Novelkeys Cream Clickie
description: Linear clicky switch with a membrane-like mechanism similar to Futaba MA.

name: Gateron North Pole 2.0
description: Features a soft insert at the base of the stem for a dampening effect.

name: TTC Brother/Frozen Silent/Bluish White
description: Dampening inserts in the stem; Brother is the only mass-produced MX silent clicky switchwith a click jacket.

name: TTC Brother v2/Frozen Silent v2/Bluish White v2
description: Dampening inserts in the stem; Brother is the only mass-produced MX silent clicky switch with a click bar.

name: TTC Tiger
description: Features a multi-component stem and housing.

name: ROLLER LINEAR SWITCHES (Ball Bearing Switches)
description: Utilizes steel ball bearings for smooth travel (includes Wuque Studio Pearl and X-ray Roller).

name: MK Dose
description: Features two contact groups.

name: Boba U4Tx
description: Silent long-pole tactile switches.

name: Libertouch
description: Membrane switch with a rubber dome designed for a mechanical-like feel.

name: CK x Haimu Clipper Sea Serpent
description: Clip-In switches that snap directly into the PCB.

name: Outemu Snap
description: The first midprofile switches in the MX ecosystem.

name: TECSEE Medium
description: Midprofile switches with 2.2mm total travel.

name: GTMX Mid Profile (Gazzew Outemu)
description: Midprofile tactile and clicky switches with a consistent construction using an additional spring.

name: HORI EDGE 201
description: Midprofile mechanical switch design.
